Package camzup.core

Class Mat3

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Mat3
Direct Known Subclasses:
KtMat3
public class Mat3
extends java.lang.Object
A mutable, extensible class influenced by GLSL, OSL and Processing's PMatrix2D. Although this is a 3 x 3 matrix, it is assumed to be a 2D affine transform matrix, where the last row is (0.0, 0.0, 1.0) . Instance methods are limited, while most static methods require an explicit output variable to be provided.

  • Field Details

    • m00

      public float m00
      Component in row 0, column 0. The right axis x component.

    • m01

      public float m01
      Component in row 0, column 1. The forward axis x component.

    • m02

      public float m02
      Component in row 0, column 2. The translation x component.

    • m10

      public float m10
      Component in row 1, column 0. The right axis y component.

    • m11

      public float m11
      Component in row 1, column 1. The forward axis y component.

    • m12

      public float m12
      Component in row 1, column 2. The translation y component.

    • m20

      public float m20
      Component in row 2, column 0. The right axis z component.

    • m21

      public float m21
      Component in row 2, column 1. The forward axis z component.

    • m22

      public float m22
      Component in row 2, column 2. The translation z component.

    • getElm

      public float getElm​(int index)
      Simulates bracket subscript access in a one-dimensional, row-major matrix array. Works with positive integers in [0, 8] or negative integers in [-9, -1] .
      Parameters:
      index - the index
      Returns:
      the component at that index

    • getElm

      public float getElm​(int i, int j)
      Simulates bracket subscript access in a two-dimensional, row-major matrix array. Works with positive integers in [0, 2][0, 2] or negative integers in [-3, -1][-3, -1] .
      Parameters:
      i - the row index
      j - the column index
      Returns:
      the component at that index

    • setCol

      public Mat3 setCol​(int j, Vec2 source)
      Sets a column of this matrix with an index and vector. If the column is an axis vector, the w or z component is set to 0.0; if it is a translation, the w or z component is set to 1.0.
      Parameters:
      j - the column index
      source - the column
      Returns:
      this matrix

    • decompose

      public static float decompose​(Mat3 m, Vec2 trans, Vec2 scale)
      Decomposes a matrix into its constituent transforms: translation, rotation and scale. Rotation is returned from the function, while translation and scale are loaded into out parameters.
      Parameters:
      m - the matrix
      trans - the output translation
      scale - the output scale
      Returns:
      the rotation

    • fromAxes

      public static Mat3 fromAxes​(Vec2 right, Vec2 forward, Mat3 target)

    • fromAxes

      public static Mat3 fromAxes​(Vec2 right, Vec2 forward, Vec2 translation, Mat3 target)
      Creates a matrix from two axes and a translation. The third row, z or w, is assumed to be (0.0, 0.0, 1.0) .
      Parameters:
      right - the right axis
      forward - the forward axis
      translation - the translation
      target - the output matrix
      Returns:
      the matrix

    • fromSkew

      public static Mat3 fromSkew​(float radians, Vec2 a, Vec2 b, Mat3 target)
      Creates skew, or shear, matrix from an angle and axes. Vectors a and b are expected to be orthonormal, i.e. perpendicular and of unit length.
      Parameters:
      radians - the angle in radians
      a - the skew axis
      b - the orthonormal axis
      target - the output matrix
      Returns:
      the skew matrix

    • mul

      public static Mat3 mul​(Mat3 a, Mat3 b, Mat3 c, Mat3 target)

      Parameters:
      a - the first matrix
      b - the second matrix
      c - the third matrix
      target - the output matrix
      Returns:
      the product

    • mul

      public static Vec3 mul​(Mat3 a, Vec3 b, Vec3 target)
      Multiplies a matrix and a vector.
      Parameters:
      a - the matrix
      b - the vector
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the product

    • mul

      public static Vec3 mul​(Vec3 a, Mat3 b, Vec3 target)
      Following GLSL convention, multiplies a vector and the transpose of a matrix.

      vT M = ( MT v )T
      Parameters:
      b - the matrix
      a - the vector
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the product

    • mulPoint

      public static Vec2 mulPoint​(Mat3 a, Vec2 b, Vec2 target)
      Multiplies a matrix and a point. The z component of the point is assumed to be 1.0, so the point is impacted by the matrix's translation.
      Parameters:
      a - the matrix
      b - the point
      target - the output point
      Returns:
      the product

    • mulVector

      public static Vec2 mulVector​(Mat3 a, Vec2 b, Vec2 target)
      Multiplies a matrix and a vector. The z component of the vector is assumed to be 0.0 , so the vector is not impacted by the matrix's translation.
      Parameters:
      a - the matrix
      b - the vector
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the product

    • negate

      Parameters:
      m - the input matrix
      target - the output matrix
      Returns:
      the negation

      public static boolean none​(Mat3 m)
      Tests to see if all the matrix's components are zero.

      m - the input matrix
      Returns:
      the evaluation

    • not

      public static Mat3 not​(Mat3 m, Mat3 target)
      Evaluates a matrix like a boolean, where n != 0.0 is true.
      Parameters:
      m - the input matrix
      target - the output matrix
      Returns:
      the truth table opposite

      a - left operand
      b - right operand
      target - the output matrix

      the evaluation
